meanings.definition: To mark or designate with an obelisk.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist obelised the ancient ruins for future generations to admire.
meanings.sent2: The city council obelised the historical site with a tall monument.
meanings.sent3: The children obelised their secret hideout with a makeshift obelisk made of sticks.
meanings.sent4: The artist obelised the skyline with bold strokes of paint on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The gardener obelised the garden path with small stone obelisks to guide visitors.

meanings.definition: To criticize or call attention to in a public manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher obelised the student's behavior in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: The journalist obelised the government's actions in her latest article.
meanings.sent3: The comedian obelised the absurdity of modern life in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The activist obelised the lack of environmental policies with a powerful speech.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor obelised the noisy parties next door by putting up a sign asking for quiet.
